number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												On paper, this game shouldn't work but it's managed to work itself together so flawlessly that I'm actually in awe of how good it actually is!Think of this game like a cross between minecraft, Terraria, and (of all things) Rogue Legacy. Don't let the first two games on that list fool you though, there's no underground. In fact you can't dig at all. You're just a PC running through a linear platformer trying desperately to pull together the materials to be able to push onward, all the while praying the RNG doesn't decide to ruin your flow.  Because while this game might be no small amount skill, luck plays an incredible role in deciding if you'll survive another level, so for casual players actually making it to the end might take some time... thankfully, despite a death being game over, this game manages to keep you going by giving you little rewards to help customize your playthrough, like races with different starting items and racial perks, hats that give you bonuses (the prerequisite to gain said hat in the hat selection menu,) and companions.. that aren't as useful as you'd think, but I still got a warm and fuzzy feeling when I got my regen fairy!  Beyond that, it's a very flow intensive game that can be fiendishly difficult to win if you get hit one too many times due to healing items being fairly scarce, but a well timed move or two can typically get you out of the way with enough skill.More on the RGN though, there are a finite amount of resources on a single level and sometimes you won't get what you need. Need gold? Sorry, no gold on this screen. Maybe you need bugs to craft spells... nope, no bugs. The game honestly seems fairly fickle at times, but three of the possible biomes are fairly easy, so it's no reason to sweat... unless of course the game decides to spawn 3 dungeon doors on you early on, THEN you should be worried. Furthermore, the stat system works nicely, the abilities seem quite solid for the various class choices you can build (although warrior does seem to lack some survivability), and the abilities you unlock are quite random, so you shouldn't have a playthrough that's too much like your other playthroughs as you're going on.Finally, there's the multiplayer system. Getting started in multiplayer is a LOT harder than in single player, but if you can actually get everything going the game's a LOT easier with a second person by your side. I haven't found a natural chat feature though, so skype calling might be necessary for this if you want to quickly, and effectively chat with your friends. Even if there is a chat system, the game's fairly fast paced so I don't really think you'd have much time to type before a monster decides to goomba stomp you... and yes, monsters CAN goomba stomp you. If they land on you, they pin you down and continually deal damage on you between invincibility periods.  So in short, it's a fun game by yourself but it's much more fun, yet also slightly more aggrivating in multiplayer. Thank goodness there isn't friendly fire, or multiplayer wouldn't be recommended... granted, my only experience with multiplayer was 2 player so yeah~, it might be a little bit different with all four slots filled up.All in all, this game is well worth the $10 I paid for it with.  I'd honestly recommend this game to all of my friends, and I feel kinda sad more of my steam friends haven't gotten this themselves...

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Where must I begin. I was honestly taken aback after playing this game for the first hour or so. Before I go into saying why I was taken aback I have to say this from first impression of watching my friends video on this game I was honestly not too impressed (then again he kinda sucked at the game when he played it). Now back to the subject at hand here, I say that I was taken aback because it well exceeded my expectations of being a pixelated 2-D side scroller. While yes I will give this game the benifit of the doubt and say that this was a pixelated game, but this was a really well done game and I think this game earns a good 9/10 if not a 10/10. My reason, well let's just say that this was a very colorful game, and no, not as colorful as Akihabara (that's a district in Tokyo for those who don't know) and to add on, the lighting for this game was absolutely incredible. You would expect like a pixelated light source on you character and the ground (because the ground does in fact illuminate which is awesome all in itself) but it is in fact a smooth lighting which in my opinion is absolutely glorious. Now let's move, for story, well let's just say that I haven't played the game enough to see the story develop but I am willing to bet that there is a story so for now I will leave this section unrated. For gameplay, I will admit it right now that I love games that make you want to replay it so many times and this game has done it. Though I have embarrased myself in dying so many times to the point where it's not funny, I was always finding myself coming back for more and more of this game and eventually, I actually starting getting good at this game. So in the end I would have to deffinetely give gameplay a 10/10. To wrap up, I have to sadly give this game a 9/10, now I know what you are thinking right now, "but wait Boom Box, you have been ranting for the last 5 minutes about how good this game is and blah blah blah blah blah blah blah", I know but here's why I have given this game the score that I have given it. The reason why is that while yes the game seems perfect in every way there were glitches in the game but of course this game is a work in progress so I guess there is an exception there. But the real problem was this, the multiplayer. I understand that the developers of this game wanted other steam user to play with their friends and what not but really? You guys couldn't make an easier set up for those who don't like setting up the server. In my opinion I think that the developers should've created a system of setting up a server to play on that is so easy that even a zombie could do it. But at the end of the day all I can say is this, Magicite is a great game and I would highly suggest this to anyone who is interested in a real challange, but for those who are interested in a real challange with friends and aren't really good or don't know how to set up a server, I would want to excersise some caution with the multiplayer side of the game cause you are going to run into nothing but problems and wind up becoming very frustrated with the game and possible beat your dog or child, but please don't do that though. Again it's a good game and I do recomend this game to any who are interested in a good challange. Thanks, and enjoy you experience.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 24, 2015
												This is one of those games that I HATE, because it clearly has a good concept, but it's too flawed to really make use of it at all. At its heart, it's good, difficult, classic Castlvania-esque platforming action, complete with button-delay combat (which is a GOOD thing, I assure you) but it's just soooo poorly executed.Here's a couple examples:-Armor increases max health but not current health, and there's very few ways to restore health, so armor is mostly worthless.-Food can't be eaten unless you are slightly hungry, but cooked food is one of the best ways to restore health, so high-tier strategy involves "hunger grinding" to get those precious health points back.-The crafting system is convoluted and out of place. Combined with the hunger, it feels like a cash grab at emulating Minecraft.-New characters' stats cannot be chosen, only randomised, so starting a new char means clicking "randomise" until you get the stats you want.-Many things cannot be unlocked until you beat the game.-Lockmaster trait no longer does anything, but the creators never bothered taking it out, so your character may randomly have one trait instead of two if they get Lockmaster.I try to look past the problems and focus on the music and the pixel scenery and the core combat stuff, but all the bad things bog it down too much. It all just makes me want to remake the whole game from the ground up and make it work better.

number of helpful: 11 of 23 people (48%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
												Here we are in 2016, and we still have games without tutorials.This game is a highly repetetive grind fest with a cumbersome, unintuitive UI (crafting, inventory, item use; all are as bad as it gets).Roguelikes have replay value and a fresh experience each playthrough; Magicite is nigh identical every time you play, without interesting random generation.Other things are a messTaking damage causes awkward things to happen: you recieve knockback and i-frames; while in i-frames you can still put out an attack animation, but it won't do any damage. Your attacks are very laggy, so getting hit while attacking means waiting for seconds before you can actually attack. Enemies also get i-frames, but they have contact damage during said i-frames. Enemies have attack animations, but always do contact damage even from behind. Enemies get knocked back by your character, but the knockback is ambiguous.Jumps and aerial movement don't have tight controls, and the character moves with the gusto of a cement mixer.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												Magicite is decent game to play with friends.Bought it a long time ago and playd few runs today and somehow it seemed they had messed up rangers wolf ability quite a bit. Game requires quite a bit of skill and fast reflexes to play. It's a shame that most rare loot comes from the golden chests so when playing single player it's a very good choise to pick up lockpick trait.I like the chance to trait system, when you can now pick the traits you want and you don't have to spend ton of time rerolling for the desired result. I think they should same kind system for the stats, because basically if you want to play to ranger you get dex and hp, mag and hp for wizard and att and hp for warrior. Having a pool of 18 choises for stats is also too small to make it more 'random' when choosing stats for your character. Altought random is a good theme in roguelike games when it is not applied to everything.

												Magicite is an epic combination of terraria and spelunky.you start off as a peon and 2 randomly generated skills wich can be rerolled until you have the 2 you want. the game is really hard and takes a few tries before you finnally know how to handle the creatures and how to craft your items but once you know this the game will become really fun. and it will be even better with friends combining different skills and different play styles. throughout the game you will unlock different classes and hats each with their own (dis)advantage to make the game more interesting.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												This game is probably one of the most fun games I have ever touched.In general, you start out with 1 race, and a set of skills. You spawn in a forest where you have to get resources to survive and not die. Later on you unlock more races, hats, variants and things as such that give you stat boosts or special perks.The worlds themselves are breathtaking. Along with the music, the graphics are amazing, the sprites of the enemies are wonderful, and the feel of the area gets you really amped and happy to play the game.There is difficulty to this game, as not only are the enemies hard but there is also permadeath. Permadeath would pretty much be the only thing I don't like about the game, but thats more of an opinion, as permadeath in a game is not wrong its just some people like it and some don't. But having permadeath actually makes you want to play the game more and more to get further than where you were before.If I were to compare this game, I'd say it would be very close to something like terraria, but I don't usually like comparing games. Why? Because games like this are unique. This game is its own thing, nothing like I have ever played before. It showed me a whole new type of platformer and I am just so happy this game fell into my steam library.So, would I recommend this game? Certainly. Definitely worth the price!P.S. if you ever meet percyl in the forest he will destroy you

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												I tend to rate things on a Price-Enjoment scale. In terms of Magicite I have played a relatively enjoyable 30ish hours for the addmission price of $10. With a simple calculation that leaves the price 33 cents/hour, a more than far price for this game in my opinion.unfortunatly, this comes with a few disclaimers:1. The game is ment to be played A LOT and it is very brutal. Expect multiple runs meeting requirments only to lose a dice roll for your hard earned reward.2. Muliplayer isn't a garenteed thing. If the game doesn't have built in multiplayer it doesn't have multiplayer in my eyes. Magicite does have built in muliplayer but it is incredably buggy to the point where monsters are almost always in different places between users and resources flicker on and off. (occasionally one player will even continuously fall through the map untill a game restart). All this given I cannot say that Magicite is an out of the box multiplayer expirence worth anything.3. Combat. I would describe the combat as ranged or nothing, a sword will just kill you off because combat feels like two pufferfush attempting to joust and you just take to much damage to make it viable.4, Updates. Now I'm lazy so I'm just estimating here but I would say it's been more than half a year since any significant update to the game so I wouldn't get hopes up about a patch. (Will remove if updated XD -get on it man!)Conclusion:The game is a Rogue-Like. I love Rogue-Likes so Magicite has a lot going for it in my books. That said, and it pains me to say this.....I can't recomend Magicite. *GASP* it just feels incomplete.I love the concept, Don't like somewhere around 45% of the execution.if you have [ftl,boi,N-throne,Don't Starve] BUY THIS GAME, but otherwise steer clear untill your ready to accept all of it's burdens and glory.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2016
												This is a good game in and of itself for single player which is fun and great and all. it\'s fun to play for those who like a slider style crafting game with many in-game unlockables like characters, companions, and hats (most of which have in game effects). However, since the developers have abandoned the game multiplayer doesn\'t really work. With my bf whoever hosts, their game works fine and they can play easily. but whoever isn\'t hosting ends up being glitched and stuck either in previous levels/towns unable to continue or move. they slowly catch up but still cannot move or continue. So unless the creators come back and overhall the game or redo their system so that it runs off of steam connection rather than a third party (such as hamachi, evolve or other which eats up ram and causes big latency problems described above) the multiplayer only lasts a few levels before you\'ll have major problems with your other players. thus making the multiplayer useless.Otherwise, Magicite is a fun single player game with many achievement based unlockables of varying difficulties. Naturally most would be easier with a second person to help (such as the no hp potion usage in game). I really like this game and wish the creators would at least come back to FIX the problems such as black screening and multiplayer set to steam connection. people have invested money into this game, which isn\'t really that expensive, and CONTINUE to do so because they like it and want other people to be able to play with them, but soon realize they cannot. its a VERY POSITIVE voted game, when really it should be lower due to the inability of using the multiplayer option that most people aren\'t aware of until after they\'ve purchased the game for themselves, and likely another person.fun game, would be great if it could be multiplayer.4/10 rating honestly because most of the game is fun with other people.. and someone who would APPEAR to take pride in their creation abandoning it is honestly disgusting to me, if you publish something like this, don\'t leave it up for people to waste their time on if you aren\'t going to continue to at least keep it running smoothly, you don\'t need to ADD more, just keep it running just as people keep paying for it. you\'re being paid =/

												Let me give you a quick perspective on this: the game isn't necessarily bad. There's a few unintuitive bits about it, but it's basically alright. The problem is once you've figured out everything there's no challenge remaining.But more importantly, a little investigation reveals that this game is basically abandoned: The last update for it was released over a year ago, in Febuary 2015. It's very insubstantial and they plan on adding no additional content to this and it becomes real dull real fast. You should try and buy it on sale, if anything.

content:
Posted: February 1, 2016
												Magicite is a cute little, fiendish roguelite action platformer with simplistic gameplay and graphics but addictive features that make you want to keep on playing. The game covers inventory, crafting and items very well as it does its platforming. The combat is decent and revolves heavily around timing and stats. It does not take long to get used to the game’s controls and its basic crafting techniques, but when you do it’s a little joy of a game. You could place Magicite under the easy to learn hard to master games but once you’ve got the hang of it and you’ve gotten better it is not that difficult. My least favourite thing about this game is that once you have a good run and gear and then you die you have to start from the beginning again. It kind of makes this easier to take because you can receive different races, hats and companions and cosmetics from achieving certain things in a run. Magicite is not endless and has several bosses, (none of which I have defeated yet) and an ending. All together I Think Magicite is a superb video game and would recommend it to anybody who enjoys roguelites that don’t require an obscene amount of time and can take their characters death. I think it is very underrated and should get more light.7/10Note to Developers: I would love to see steam achievements implemented please!

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
												Great concept, but I would not recommend because of networking issues.  A friend and I started out with no knowledge of the game and died instantly a dozen times in a row, but that's part of the learning.  It was satisfying to progress through and figure out the crafting, and eventually we got to level 11 with some diamondite armor before quitting.But the online play seems to always run into connectivity issues somewhere along the way.  One person would start dropping through the world and not be able to see any other characters, or they couldn't be revived, or items would de-sync and duplicate.  If two players pressed a portal at the same time, we would skip a zone every single time.  We had to agree on who would activate portals to avoid any issues.Since this game has NO saves and makes it very challenging to make any progress at all, the fact that the networking breaks constantly is a huge deal-breaker.  I don't consider it worth playing at all unless they decide to fix those issues.
